body: Are you certain this still happens since https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/commit/aa1c2742314b1d1a6edb0453ca5f1b1d957db631? Any folder config change except label triggers a folder restart.

Yeah, I am certain. I've just done another test. The junction wasn't detected until I manually paused and resumed the folder.

I guess this requires a Windows system to test, so if I can help with any special debug logs, please let me know.
model debug log that shows the sequence of events (config change, scan, pause-resume, scan) would be a good start

Here you go.

```

[DHK2G] 2022/01/29 17:49:40.258058 syncthing.go:353: INFO: Exiting
```

I did the following.

1. Add a new, empty folder to Syncthing.
2. In the folder, create a junction using the command line.
3. Enable `junctionsAsDir` for the folder.
4. Click the "rescan" button, but with no success.
5. Pause and resume the folder.
6. Only now has the junction been detected.
Ah yes, I only thought about the folder config and it's `.Filesystem`. However there's also the `FileSet` with its `.MtimeFS`. Thanks!

issue.title: lib/db, lib/model: Remove filesystem state from FileSet (fixes #7850)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
We don't replace the `FileSet` on folder restart (as that's a potentially heavy/slow operation), but the filesystem is stored in it and thus any changes to the filesystem won't apply. I don't see any good reason to keep the filesystem in state in the db/fileset, it also removes a lot of boilerplate from tests.

Fixes #7850

body:
I have the same problem.
In local device, I have sync-folder _AA_ and another ordinary folder _AAA_.
I add junction link for folder _AAA_ to sync-folder _AA_.
All content from folder _AAA_ syncing  immediately to remote device.
Then I add **new** file to folder _AAA_, it not syncyng to remote device.
If I run rescan from GUI, or if I pause/start folder syncyng, the new file start syncyng to remore device.
If on remote device I add new file to folder  _AAA_, it syncyng to local device immediately without rescan/restart.

Both device run with **v1.20.3, Windows (64-bit Intel/AMD)**

That is a different problem. I think there was a topic on the forum about this recently, and it was proven that watching for changes didn't work in folder junctions. This means that if you want to sync the files quickly, you need to set a shorter rescan interval instead.

This information should probably be added to the Docs next to the config option.
